User Guide

This guide provides detailed information about using Debug Player.

Table of Contents

  • Interface Overview
    • Main Window Layout
    • Menu Bar

Interface Overview

Main Window

The main window consists of the following components:

  1. Menu Bar: Access to file operations, view options, and help

  2. Toolbar: Quick access to common actions

  3. Signal Browser: List of available signals and plugins

  4. Plot Area: Displays the selected signals

  5. Timeline: Navigate through the data

  6. Status Bar: Shows current time and other status information

Signal Browser

The signal browser allows you to:

  • View available signals organized by plugin

  • Show/hide signals in the plot

  • Adjust signal properties (color, line style, etc.)

  • Group related signals together

Plot Area

The plot area is where your signals are visualized. You can:

  • Zoom in/out using the mouse wheel or +/- buttons

  • Pan by clicking and dragging

  • Add annotations and markers

  • Adjust plot settings (axis labels, grid, etc.)

Timeline

The timeline at the bottom of the window allows you to:

  • Navigate through the data

  • Select time ranges for analysis

  • Set loop points for playback

Working with Data

Loading Data

  1. Click “File” > “Open” or press Ctrl+O

  2. Navigate to your data file and select it

  3. Supported formats: CSV, HDF5, Parquet, and more via plugins

Saving and Exporting

  • Save Session: Save the current layout and settings

  • Export Data: Export the current view or selected signals to various formats

  • Save Plot: Save the current plot as an image (PNG, SVG, PDF)

Signal Operations

  • Math Operations: Perform mathematical operations on signals

  • Filtering: Apply filters to signals

  • Statistics: Calculate statistics for selected time ranges

Plugins

Debug Player supports plugins to extend its functionality. Plugins can:

  • Add support for new file formats

  • Provide custom signal processing

  • Add new visualization types

  • Integrate with external tools

To manage plugins:

  1. Click “Plugins” in the menu bar

  2. Select “Load Plugin” to add a new plugin

  3. Use “Plugin Manager” to enable/disable plugins

Keyboard Shortcuts

Navigation

Zooming

File Operations

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  1. Slow Performance - Reduce the number of visible signals - Increase the decimation factor in settings - Close other applications to free up memory

  2. Missing Signals - Check that the file was loaded successfully - Verify that the plugin for the file format is installed - Check the console for error messages

  3. Plot Display Issues - Try resetting the view (View > Reset View) - Check that the signal ranges are appropriate - Update your graphics drivers

Getting Help

  • Check the troubleshooting section

  • Visit our GitHub repository

  • Open an issue for bug reports or feature requests
